Key Match Events: Correa hit a clutch, go-ahead, two-run single in the 10th inning
Post-Match Reflections: The loss trimmed the Twins’ lead over the Tigers for the AL’s final Wild Card berth down to a half-game
Bailey Ober struck out a career-high 12 batters in seven innings
Correa extended his hitting streak to 16 games, matching a career-high and the longest by a Twin this season
Correa and Byron Buxton have shown every bit of why the Twins pushed them back without rehab assignments to join the team for the stretch run
With Brock Stewart lost for the season and Justin Topa and Chris Paddack still not ready, this is where the bullpen is at
Miscellaneous Highlights: The depleted bullpen ran out of gas
Ronny Henriquez and Michael Tonkin allowed three runs in a 5-4, walk-off loss to the Guardians
Henriquez entered for the 10th inning and allowed an RBI single to Kyle Manzardo, walked Andrés Giménez and gave up the game-tying knock to Will Brennan
Tonkin relieved and Brayan Rocchio chopped a grounder over the head of first baseman Carlos Santana to walk off for the win
